class_notes:
Title: Narrative Medicine: Creative Writing for Healing and Connection
Narrative medicine is a model for humane and effective medical practice that uses narrative competence, the ability to interpret and act on the stories and plights of others, to connect physicians to patients' illness experiences. This course is designed for students considering careers as physicians to engage with the stories of others and supplement their STEM-centered curriculum. In class, students will participate in story circles, writing assignments, and guided reading discussions.
course_description: A side-car course brings together a subset of students from two courses that overlap in methodologies, topics, etc., to create a short interdisciplinary course that runs simultaneously with its two sponsoring courses. One credit, S/U only. Schedule and format arranged by sponsoring professors.
